page.title: 13ST.MARY'S SCHOOL,MELROSE
page.content: St.Mary's School house was built in 1784,the private school for boys started in 1895.It became co-educational in 1976.The school was named after Melrose Abbey,St.Mary's. There are 121 children in school at present,aged four and a half to thirteen and a half years old.The staff consists of 12 teachers who teach classes ranging from 8 to 20 pupils.Some children are long term boarders,whose parents live abroad,and weekly boarders who live within 50 miles of the school and go home at weekends.These children live in dormitories in the main house and in Buccleugh Street in Melrose.There are also day children who live within 10 miles of the school.School uniform is brown and yellow.A regular curriculum is offered,priority being given to Maths,Latin,Modern Languages and Sport
